position: Research Intern – Software Engineer for Medical Ultrasound
description:
null **In this role, you have the opportunity to**

+ **Provide high impact innovation in one of the most widely used medical imaging modalities – ultrasound**

+ **Interact with domain experts and build first-to-world solutions that have the potential to contribute to shaping the industry and affecting patient care in the near future**

+ **Strengthen your expertise in software engineering for ultrasound imaging scanners**

+ **Implement and validate novel algorithms for product release**

+ **Document the work and contribute to the publication of the work**

**You are responsible for**

+ **System implementation, testing, and optimization of signal and image processing algorithms for ultrasound imaging using C/C++**

+ **Documentation of system implementation/modifications**

+ **Reporting results to company and business stakeholders**

+ **Help the team build its knowledge in system implementation and C/C++ programming**

+ **If applicable, work with the team to draft relevant IP**

**You are a part of** **You are part of a dynamic applied research team with broad experience in core ultrasound imaging and signal processing**

**To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience**

+ **Computer Science/Electrical/Biomedical/Mechanical Engineering or Mathematics students at all levels are welcome to apply**

+ **Rich experience in programming, algorithm/system implementation using C/C++. Experience with GPU computing using CUDA is a plus**

+ **Familiar with basic signal and image processing**

+ **Background/knowledge in medical ultrasound imaging is preferred but not required**

+ **The successful intern will be self-driven and independent worker, but also able to interact closely with the larger team**

+ **Communication must be fluent in English, both written and verbal, to ensure constructive scientific dialogue.**

**Why should you join Philips?** **Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.** **To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.** **Are you interested in an Intern opportunity with Philips? We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing (or have recently completed) a BS degree to participate in a 3** **_-month_** **paid internship opportunity. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience working in a HealthTech company.**

Overview

JM Family Enterprises, Inc. is one of the largest, most innovative and diversified companies in the automotive industry. JM Family has been on Fortune Magazine's Best Companies to Work For for 20 consecutive years. What started with Jim Moran's passion for selling cars continues today with the dedication and hard work of every JM Family associate. Our principal businesses focus on vehicle distribution and processing, finance and insurance, retail vehicle sales, and dealer technology services. At JM Family, our mission is to be the premier provider of quality products and services. We accomplish this mission by adhering to our core values, the three C’s, the I and the A: Consideration, Cooperation, Communication, Innovation, and Accountability. 

 

The JM Family College Internship Program is designed to create an opportunity for college students to have meaningful work experiences that tie to their programs of study. The program is a 10 week paid remote internship. Students must be available to intern from June 7 - August 13, 2021. Students in the program will actively contribute to their team's success, learn about JM Family's company and culture and obtain new skills through learning opportunities and networking events. The individual selected for this internship will be responsible for supporting their department in a variety of functions and will have exposure to activities related to the department's initiatives. The intern will also gain access to professional development opportunities through the internship program. Some of these opportunities include business presentation skills classes, lunch and learns and career readiness workshops. 

Job Description

This internship provides the opportunity to work closely with JM&A Group’s Data and Analytics Team, and participate in various projects related to data science, data analytics, and predictive modeling. Graduate students or advanced undergraduates in the areas of mathematics and computer science, with some experience coding and manipulating data sets, and an interest in how these fields are applied in the analysis of data are encouraged to apply. 

 

Job responsibilities will vary based on the applicant’s background and qualifications, and may include: 

  • Support creation of data lake and various databases and applications to deliver business intelligence to management decision makers 
  • Review model structure and output diagnostics to assist with maintenance and improvement of model parameters 
  • Maintain APIs and applications to deliver recommendations to end users in real time 
  • Assist with coding various applications to deliver reporting and model outputs to support decision making by various management stakeholders 
  • Visualize data using code or appropriate tools such as Tableau or PowerBI 

#LI-JD1 #LI-REMOTE

Job Requirements

  • Must be a minimum of 18 years old at the start of the program (June 7, 2021) 
  • Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
  • Required to be actively pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree at an accredited college or university
  • Preferred majors are Mathematics or Computer Science
  • Completed at least one semester of study at an accredited college or university

Company Description

Symbotic’s talented and diverse workforce develops disruptive robotic solutions for warehouse automation and supply chain transformation, drives results and focuses on customer satisfaction. Our modular and scalable solutions utilize existing space and high-speed robotics combined with proprietary software and technology. Since forming in 2007, Symbotic has grown to over 700 employees in North America and supports an impressive, high-profile customer base. We seek candidates who are passionate about our solution and approach problem solving with a creative mind and a commitment to excellence. If you seek a challenge and want to impact the way the world distributes product from manufacturers to store shelves, we invite you to join our team.

Job Description

The Machine Learning Team at Symbotic is expanding, and we’re looking to hire an intern for an extended period to extract insight from data generated by robots. The intern will assist in the development of a predictive health monitoring application for mobile autonomous robots.

Responsibilities

  • Working with site operators to track robot localization issues, and label corresponding data
  • Prototyping of clustering algorithms identifying and localizing contaminants by aggregating robot log data
  • Implementing these algorithms in a Python application in cloud-hosted or virtualized environments.
  • Development of a data collection and labeling procedures
  • Prototype clustering algorithms to identify common experiences among multiple agents
  • Design and implementation of a Python-based application to ingest new log files & process data according to the developed algorithm
Qualifications

  • Ideal candidate profile is a graduate student studying data science or machine learning with a CS/EE background and Python experience
  • Strong programming skills
  • Experience with cloud-hosted environments a plus.


Additional Information

Symbotic offers competitive compensation and a dynamic, growing company environment. Benefits include very comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, life, disability, flexible spending accounts, and more.

Symbotic is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, gender, physical or mental disability, nation of origin, veteran status, religious beliefs, sexual identity or expression. Symbotic supports a diverse workforce and we are committed to a work environment free of discrimination and harassment, where all are treated with dignity and respect.

All Symbotic employees are required to make safety their top priority.

position: Quality Intern - Agronomist / Geospatial Analyst (Early Talent Program)
description:
Quality Intern - Agronomist / Geospatial Analyst (Early Talent Program)


Date: Mar 5, 2021


Location:

Power, MT, US


Requisition ID: 14439


Our purpose at Molson Coors Beverage Company, is to unite people to celebrate life’s moments. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re TalentBrewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate achievers who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.


The Headlines:


As an Quality Intern – Agronomist / Geospatial Analyst you will be part of our early talent program where you will learn about our business, network with other interns and have opportunities to participate in social and educational opportunities in addition to your daily job responsibilities. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August.


Molson Coors Beverage Company leverages a vertically integrated ag supply chain to source the most important solid ingredient for our iconic beers – malting barley. Our direct grower relationships provide a unique opportunity to partner with farms and understand the challenges in producing high quality malting barley while improving long term sustainability. Agriculture is evolving quickly at the intersection of technology and natural systems, striving to produce the most with the least impact. This intern position will help to begin to explore some of those relationships.


The Responsibilities:


+ Position will be based at our Power, Montana, Malt Barley Operations office

+ Utilize ESRI ArcGIS software platform and Survey123 to develop a grower database

+ Create dashboards from survey data to communicate trends

+ Provide barley grower assistance with entry of agronomic data

+ Map barley fields into a geo-spatial database

+ Learn about malt barley quality metrics and analysis

+ Gain an understanding of sustainability concepts such as soil health and regenerative ag

+ Develop knowledge of the malt barley industry in North America

+ Learn about the links in a vertically integrated, food ingredient supply chain


The Qualifications:


You are pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Earth Science, Agroecology, Sustainability, or Crop Science, 3.0 GPA or higher.


Prior coursework, internship or work experience using GIS, GPS, or spatial analysis.


Knowledge of ArcGIS, Survey123, and Microsoft Office tools.


Utilize strong oral communication and computer skills and operate within a team to build customer and stakeholder relationships.


Holding a valid passport is a preference.


Ability to work full-time 40+ hours per week during the summer.


At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

Schrödinger seeks a Computational Biology Intern to work on new and exciting drug discovery and development programs.

Our company aims to revolutionize drug design through the use of breakthrough computational methods. Our powerful platform is transforming the discovery of novel therapeutics, and we’re developing a strong preclinical pipeline and portfolio in multiple therapeutic areas, including oncology, immunology and neurology.

Who will love this job:

  • A capable collaborator who’s eager to learn and adopt novel methodologies to answer biological questions An enthusiastic scientist who understands large data consortia and genomic data structures
  • A proficient R and/or Python programmer who’s familiar with machine learning techniques
  • An excellent verbal and written communicator

What you’ll do:

  • Work on programs in early drug discovery and translational research with a group of energetic scientists and developers
  • Apply modern machine learning methods to challenging computational problems
  • Interpret analysis results in a biological or disease context
  • Mine large-scale genomic data for biomarker discovery and program advancement

What you should have:

  • A graduate major in computational biology, bioinformatics, statistics, computer science or a related field (we will consider undergrads with robust relevant experience)
  • Broad background in genomics, computational biology, and/or machine learning
  • Experience analyzing multi-omics genomic data, especially with large public data sets
 
Pay and perks:
Schrödinger understands it’s people that make a company great. Because of this, we’re prepared to offer a competitive salary, stock options, and a wide range of benefits that include healthcare (with dental and vision), a 401k, pre-tax commuter benefits, a flexible work schedule, and a parental leave program. We have catered meals in the office every day, a company culture that is relaxed but engaged, and over a month of paid vacation time.  Our Administrative and Human Resources departments also plan a myriad of fun company-wide events. New York is home to our largest office, but we have teams all over the world. Schrödinger is honored to have been selected as one of Crain's New York Best Places to Work for the past three years running.
 
Sound exciting? Apply today and join us!
 
As an equal opportunity employer, Schrödinger hires outstanding individuals into every position in the company. People who work with us have a high degree of engagement, a commitment to working effectively in teams, and a passion for the company's mission. We place the highest value on creating a safe environment where our employees can grow and contribute, and refuse to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious belief, sex, age, disability, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, partnership status, caregiver status, sexual and reproductive health decisions, gender identity or expression, or sexual orientation. To us, "diversity" isn't just a buzzword, but an important element of our core principles and key business practices. We believe that diverse companies innovate better and think more creatively than homogenous ones because they take into account a wide range of viewpoints. For us, greater diversity doesn't mean better headlines or public images - it means increased adaptability and profitability.

position: Transportation Engineering R&D Lab Assistants - INTERN
description:
Description




Job Description:

Are you interested in Autonomous Vehicles and intelligent transportation systems?



Do you want to collaborate with scientists and engineers at a world class Federal R&D center for Connected and Autonomous Vehicles?


Leidos is seeking Transportation Research and Development Engineer Lab Assistants (R&D Lab Assistants) INTERN to join our team at the Saxton Transportation and Operations Laboratory (STOL or Saxton Lab), in McLean, VA.


The STOL or Saxton Lab supports the USDOT and Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) with a range of transportation and operations research programs.


This is a hands-on opportunity to be part of a large interdisciplinary research team that advances connected and automated vehicle technologies by developing, testing, and demonstrating new capabilities associated with Vehicle-to-Vehicle and Vehicle-to-Infrastructure communications (V2V, V2I, and V2X).


http://careers.leidos.com/stol


Primary Responsibilities


The R&D Lab Assistant INTERN will participate in some or all of the following:

+ Assisting engineers and researchers with various phases of scientific research and laboratory upkeep.

+ Configuring hardware and software systems required for control of traffic signals, traffic management systems, and vehicle guidance systems.

+ Completing routine laboratory tasks as defined in Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).

+ Contributing to the development of new best practices and SOPs for laboratory tasks.

+ Configuring electrical, scientific, or networking equipment under supervision of senior engineers.

+ Data collection and record keeping






Note: *The selected INTERN will be required to operate the vehicles and may have an opportunity for advanced driver training to serve as a Safety Driver for vehicle testing*




Basic Qualifications

+ Candidates must be enrolled in a degree program in a relevant scientific or technical discipline such as Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science, Automotive Technology, etc.

+ Aptitude for technology and interest in intelligent transportation solutions.

+ Must be a good team player and able to give and take constructive feedback.

+ Must be prompt, schedule-conscious, and able to focus on the work at hand.

+ Valid driver’s license and suitability to operate a motor vehicle.

+ Your GPA needs to be included on your application and resume.




US Citizenship Requirements


Candidate must be able to obtain an Public Trust clearance.






Preference for candidates with any of the following Qualifications:

+ Linux experience.

+ Familiarity with networking technologies – routers, switches, headless computer systems.

+ Some programming/scripting experience – MATLAB, Python, JAVA, C++, or other.

+ Electromechanical troubleshooting experience

+ Direct research experience contributing to the authorship of a technical paper.






External Referral Bonus:Ineligible


Potential for Telework:No


Clearance Level Required:Public Trust


Travel:No


Scheduled Weekly Hours:40


Shift:Day


Requisition Category:Intern


Job Family:Intern Technical


Pay Range:




Leidos is a Fortune 500®information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.


Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here (https://www.leidos.com/careers/pay-benefits) .


Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.





REQNUMBER: R-00047340
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. Leidos will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in accordance with relevant Laws. Leidos is an equal opportunity employer/disability/vet.

The Statistical Programming Intern will provide statistical programming support in all clinical trials conducted in Transcatheter Heart Valve (THV) business unit.


Intern Will Learn and Be Exposed to:


+ Good statistical programming practice.

+ Hands on SAS or R programming using real life clinical trial data.

+ Participate in regular team meetings and Brownbag Sharing and Learning meetings.


Responsibilities:


+ Review TLG output in comparing with table shells to ensure the output TLGs consistent with the table shells.

+ Work with lead statistical programmer for the study to create eCRF SDTM annotation file based on SDTM specifications.

+ Create statistical programming related documents.

+ Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Qualifications:


+ Internship applicants must be enrolled in an accredited Bachelor’s or Master’s program (Master’s preferred) in Biostatistics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Sciences, Engineering or related fields for the entire duration of their internship. Upon graduating, students are no longer eligible for an internship at Edwards.

+ Must graduate December 2021 or later.

+ Related courses taken at school should include but not limited to Statistics, Probability, Linear Regression, Mathematical Modeling and any related statistics or mathematics courses.

+ Some R or SAS programming experience or had R or SAS programming course is a must.

+ Knowledge of other programming languages, such as C++, Java or Python etc. is a big plus.

+ Good understanding of statistical techniques and computer skills in interfacing MS Office Suite are preferred.

+ Good communication skills are required.

+ Eager to learn and be proactive in chasing solutions to problems or achieving results.

+ Availability for an assignment for a minimum of 10 weeks.

+ Must be in good scholastic standing (3.0+ GPA or equivalent).

+ Must not require company sponsorship for an employment-based visa now or in the future.


Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.


Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 15,000 individuals worldwide.


For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life.

**Position Overview:**
      
      The Climate Corporation's data scientists and analysts expertly combine complex data layers (agronomic, grower, supply chain, commercial, clickstream, satellite imagery, genomics, weather) and continually investigate, experiment, and find insights that drive our mission. Combining those complex data sets with scalable technology, they support scientific research, product development, and commercial initiatives.
      
      **What You Will Do:**
      
      + Partner with stakeholders (Science, Product, Engineering) to support the execution of data-intensive projects, enable superior decision-making and analysis, and standardize data science practices throughout the organization
      
      + Enable timely and insightful reports, dashboards, metrics, and advanced analytics to monitor and positively impact the performance of our company
      
      + Accelerate data science innovation and adoption (machine learning, deep learning, hierarchical modeling) using state-of-the-art frameworks and infrastructure
      
      + Creatively incorporate data science and statistical methods to the challenges of product development, understanding how science impacts end-user behavior
      
      + Effectively tell the story behind the data to product partners and propose recommendations to senior management
      
      **Basic Qualifications:**
      
      + Currently pursuing a MS or PhD in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
      
      + Ability to develop and review code using standard languages and frameworks (e.g. Python, TensorFlow) and/or database languages (e.g. SQL) and visualization tools (e.g. Looker)
      
      + Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
      
      + Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations
      
      **Preferred Qualifications:**
      
      + Background in data science or machine learning engineering
      
      + Experience and/or interest in cloud computing platforms (e.g. AWS)
      
      + Experience in translating business questions into appropriate statistical techniques applied to available data
      
      + Familiarity with experiment design to statistically measure the impact of new product features and commercial campaigns
      
      + Knowledge of key performance indicators and how they impact business decisions
      
      + Experience creating data pipelines
      
      + Enjoy working in a team-oriented, multidisciplinary environment
      
      + Passion for data and technology
      
      **What We Offer:**
      
      Our environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with a diverse set of top engineers, agronomists, and statisticians working together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.
      
      + We offer competitive pay and perks.
      
      + We provide meals and a large assortment of snacks and drinks to get you through the day.
      
      + You'll get 1:1 mentoring from a talented and motivated employee on your team.
      
      + You'll have the opportunity to work on real projects with experienced employees and have a direct impact on the company. (Our internships are not summer camp!)
      
      + You'll have the amazing opportunity to participate in one of our Biotechnology Tours where you get out of the office and into the field (literally) with agents and farmers.
      
      + You'll work in an award winning office with smart designs, large common areas and open floor plans that fuel collaboration.
      
      + You'll attend various company sponsored events, activities and off-sites - we make sure interns are having fun!
      
      + We regularly host meet-up groups and tech-talks and encourage participation in relevant workshops and conferences
      
      + You'll have the opportunity to interaction with key executives and leadership.
      
      We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:
      
      + Inspire one another
      
      + Innovate in all we do
      
      + Leave a mark on the world
      
      + Find the possible in the impossible
      
      + Be direct and transparent
      
      Learn more about our team and our mission:
      
      The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference
      
      https://youtu.be/c5TgbpE9UBI  or visit  https://climate.com/careers
      
      Climate aims to create a welcoming and collaborative environment for our employees in which a diverse set of perspectives and voices are represented and celebrated.
      
      As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, The Climate Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sex (including pregnancy), protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any unlawful criterion existing under applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at  accommodations@climate.com .

Company Name: Tamarack Farms Dairy
Position Type: Intern
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
 

About the Location:  Tamarack Farms Dairy - Newark, Ohio – $16.00/hour

Tamarack Farms Dairy was built in 1978. The plant is 140,000 sq. foot and it sits on 20 acres. The plant is home to an estimated 160 union, hourly, and management employees.

Tamarack Farms Diary is the largest fluid dairy in the state of Ohio, receiving over one million pounds of milk daily. We pride ourselves on being one of the lowest cost producers in the country. Tamarack produces over 100 items of fluid milk, cultured products, and beverages.  Some of the products that we produce include sour cream, yogurts, milk (including chocolate), cottage cheese, bulk cream, orange juice, teas, apple cider.  We also produce certified organic milk, yogurt, and sour cream products.  Tamarack also has a blowmold department where we produce gallon and half-gallon bottles from resin.

Tamarack Farms Dairy supports about over 200 Kroger stores in Ohio and West Virginia, and three distribution centers in Ohio, Indiana, and Kentucky.  We are also the sole supplier of organic yogurt and sour cream products for all stores enterprise wide.  We produce custom products for Graeter’s Ice Cream and Panera Bread as well.  Tamarack Farms Dairy is committed to providing only the highest quality products manufactured in a safe and healthy work environment. 

Tamarack is SQF Level 3 certified.

 

About the Position:

As a Kroger Manufacturing Quality Assurance Intern, you will have the opportunity to learn the science of large-scale food manufacturing through a 10-week program designed to help students in their professional development and provide hands-on real-world experience.  Our programs are unique to the facilities that host them and provide specialized opportunities geared towards the needs of our salted nut and dry pack department.

As a Tamarack Farms Dairy QA Intern, you will be part of a small team that meets regularly via our virtual platforms for progress updates, professional support and coaching and presentations from a variety of Kroger leaders.  Some of your essential functions as a Lab Technician Intern may include:

Projects:

-      SQF validations / verifications of systems

-      Computer File update (verify application, archive, alignment)

-      Label / formula verification

-      Sensory audit restructure
 

Tasks:

-      Scanning COA’s into system / creating sustainable system

-      Research file use with lab techs / resolve location / integrity

-      Review existing labels- validate label book

-      Review formula / validate batching sheets, book

-      Create interactive sensory audit that is sustainable / engaging

 

 

About Kroger

At Kroger, we are looking for talented and engaged individuals. We need leaders who actively participate in our mission to deliver safe, high quality products of exceptional value to our customers.  Our nationwide manufacturing team includes 30+ Dairy and Deli/Bakery facilities working hard to provide 33% of the Our Brands Units sold in Kroger stores.

Position Summary:

Complete assigned programs or program sections under supervision as a member of the team. Perform all jobs safely, efficiently and accurately to maintainand improve the performance of the entire plant in the areas of Safety, Quality, Reliability (SQR) and our Customer 1st strategy. Role model anddemonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of others.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Apply discipline specific principles through involvement in meaningful projects to expand technical and business skills. Disciplines include; HumanResources, Operations, Engineering, Sourcing & Procurement, Corporate Brands, Quality Assurance, Information systems and Finance.
  • Follow established programs, policies and practices to produce safe quality foods that meet regulatory and company requirements.
  • Support the development, implementation, maintenance, and ongoing improvement of the SQF 2000 Systems.
  • Accountable to the Kroger Manufacturing Food Safety and Quality Principles.
  • Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation.

Minimum Position Qualifications:

  • Must be at least 18 years of age.
  • High School Diploma or GED equivalent.
  • Current student actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in related field.
  • 0 to 1 year of related experience.
  • Basic math skills.
  • Strong analytical ability.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to comprehend complex verbal and written instructions.

Desired Previous Job Experience

  • Graduate degree in (discipline/s) preferred.
  • Experience in manufacturing environment.

 

Education Level: High School Diploma/ GED Required
Required Certifications/Licenses: None
Position Type: Intern 
Shift(s): Day
Regions: Midwest

States: Ohio
Keywords:

 

Jobs at Kroger Manufacturing: Through quality products, strong individual commitments and team spirit, Kroger has been established as a leader in the manufacturing industry. Kroger Manufacturing provides career development programs aligned with aspirations in Engineering, Process Management, Information Systems, Quality Assurance, Operations Management, Human Resources, Finance and Procurement. Our work force programs provide technically challenging rotations with cross-functional teams, plants and locations to allow our Associates to learn from some of the brightest minds in the business. Experience and training combined with mentoring and guidance from plant sponsors prepare our Associates with the skills and leadership behaviors needed to achieve a successful career at Kroger.

 

Company Overview: Kroger Family of Companies employs nearly half a million associates who serve over 11 million customers daily through a seamless shopping experience under a variety of banner names.  At The Kroger Co., we are Fresh for Everyone™ and dedicated to our Purpose: To Feed the Human Spirit®.  We are committed to creating #ZeroHungerZeroWaste communities by 2025.  Careers with The Kroger Co. and our family of companies offer competitive wages, flexible schedules, benefits and room for advancement.

 

 Posting Notes:  OH || Newark || 1701 Tamarack Road || 43055 || Tamarack Farms Dairy || None || Food Technology || Intern || Non-Exempt|| Intern || None

At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision - transforming patients' lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease - and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry - each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.
      
      We are seeking a highly motivated candidate to join our team for a 10-week summer internship program. This position will focus on the application of machine learning models to publicly available drug response screens, genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic datasets in order to identify molecular markers of resistance and sensitivity. The candidate will receive mentorship from experienced bioinformatic scientists and have the opportunity to interact with collaborators from other areas of expertise (e.g. oncology, clinical, chemistry). In doing so, the candidate will gain insight into the process of drug discovery and a better understanding of the role and impact a data scientist can have on the program.
      
      Key Responsibilities
      
      + Research relevant literature to build strong foundation knowledge
      
      + Implement 2 (stretch 3) statistical/ML modeling paradigms for predicting drug response from omics data
      
      + Benchmark performance across models and identify markers of sensitivity or resistance.
      
      + Document, visualize and communicate findings with manager and the broader team of stakeholders.
      
      Qualifications & Experience
      
      + Masters or PhD student enrolled in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Systems Biology or similar fields
      
      + Good programming skills in R or Python.
      
      + Foundations in Cancer Biology, Statistical Modeling, and Machine Learning
      
      + Familiarity with Github, RShiny is preferred but not essential.
      
      Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.
      
      Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

position: Intern - Advanced Solutions, Energy Data Scientist - Campus 2021
description:
Overview
      
      Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets.  We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey.  Join us at Guidehouse.
      
      Responsibilities
      
      During your internship assignment you will join our analytics team supporting Guidehouse's Energy, Sustainability, and Infrastructure group. As a member of our team you will have an opportunity to work with utilities and energy providers, investors and large corporations, NGOs, or the public sector to create sustainable, resilient communities and infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to perform a wide range of analytics-related activities including evaluating decarbonization, electrification, energy efficiency, load management, transportation electrification, and energy storage programs; forecast distributed energy resource market adoption at granular locational and temporal levels; conduct grid resiliency analytics, inform grid modernization and enhance the operational performance of grid assets; develop load forecasting models used for resource and revenue planning and performing analytics to inform rate design; use analytics to inform client business strategy and identify process improvements. 
      
      Qualifications
      
      Required:
      
      + Pursuing B.A./B.S. or M.A./M.S. in Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Environmental Engineering/Science, Computational Physics or other analytics degree  
      
      + Knowledge of analytical models, methods, applications and tools, such as:
      
      + Statistical analysis, regression modeling, predictive modeling, simulation, machine learning
      
      + Selecting and applying the right analytical techniques
      
      + Analyzing large and complex data sets, with strong aptitude for conducting quantitative analysis
      
      + Proficiency in one or several programming languages, such as R or Python
      
      + Proficiency with spreadsheets, word processing, and slide presentation software
      
      Desired:   
      
      + Interest in clean energy solutions, smart grid, demand management, electric mobility, decarbonization, pricing/rates, and/or advanced grid technologies 
      
      + Contributing as a team member: understanding personal and team roles, contributing to a positive working environment by building strong, collaborative relationships with team members
      
      Additional Requirements
      
      The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.
      
      This is a temporary Position under 3 months in length, expected to run June 7th through July 30th of 2021.

All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodation.

position: Data Science Intern - Research Scientist/Experimentation & Marketplace
description:
Company Description

Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. As an Etsy employee, you’ll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.

Job Description

Etsy is looking for Data Science Interns to join our Experimentation Science Team for Summer 2021.

We are committed to advancing the fields around E-commerce by building technologies to help understand our customers and the world. We are seeking individuals passionate in areas such as Causal Inference, Experimentation Science, Causal Machine Learning and Marketplace Economics. 

What we are working on

  • Causal Inference 

  • Large Experiment Design and Analysis

  • Quasi Experimentation

  • Causal Machine Learning

  • Explainability in Machine Learning

  • Online and Offline Evaluation of Machine Learning Models

  • Marketplace Economics including Pricing, Mechanism Design

For candidates who will work remotely from Colorado, visit this link for information related to Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Qualifications

  • You are currently enrolled in a full-time Ph.D degree program in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.

  • You have familiarity and experience or are interested in publishing papers at top-tier  conferences/journals in your field.

  • You have strong analytical and quantitative skills. 

  • You have strong technical and programming skills. You are familiar with relevant technologies and languages (e.g. Python, R, C, etc.). You have experience in or desire to learn Big Data technologies (e.g. BigQuery, pyspark, etc.).

  • You have demonstrated the capability to review and write technical papers.

  • You can contribute research that can be applied to Etsy product development.

  • You have the ability to quickly prototype ideas and can solve complex problems by adapting creative approaches.

  • You are a strong collaborator and communicator and you enable the engineers around you to grow and learn.  

What's Next

Hit Apply Now to upload a resume and feel free to point us to your latest publication and any other online presence you may have including Github, Weblogs and others.



Additional Information

What's Next


If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a cover letter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you’ve hopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality and variety. We don’t want you to be like everyone else — we want you to be like you! So write to us and tell us what you’re all about.

Our Promise


At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.

Position Overview: 

The Climate Corporation’s data scientists and analysts expertly combine complex data layers (agronomic, grower, supply chain, commercial, clickstream, satellite imagery, genomics, weather) and continually investigate, experiment, and find insights that drive our mission. Combining those complex data sets with scalable technology, they support scientific research, product development, and commercial initiatives.  

What You Will Do:

  • Partner with stakeholders (Science, Product, Engineering) to support the execution of data-intensive projects, enable superior decision-making and analysis, and standardize data science practices throughout the organization
  • Enable timely and insightful reports, dashboards, metrics, and advanced analytics to monitor and positively impact the performance of our company
  • Accelerate data science innovation and adoption (machine learning, deep learning, hierarchical modeling) using state-of-the-art frameworks and infrastructure
  • Creatively incorporate data science and statistical methods to the challenges of product development, understanding how science impacts end-user behavior
  • Effectively tell the story behind the data to product partners and propose recommendations to senior management

Basic Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a MS or PhD in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
  • Ability to develop and review code using standard languages and frameworks (e.g. Python, TensorFlow) and/or database languages (e.g. SQL) and visualization tools (e.g. Looker)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
  • Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Background in data science or machine learning engineering
  • Experience and/or interest in cloud computing platforms (e.g. AWS)
  • Experience in translating business questions into appropriate statistical techniques applied to available data
  • Familiarity with experiment design to statistically measure the impact of new product features and commercial campaigns
  • Knowledge of key performance indicators and how they impact business decisions
  • Experience creating data pipelines
  • Enjoy working in a team-oriented, multidisciplinary environment
  • Passion for data and technology


What We Offer:
Our environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with a diverse set of top engineers, agronomists, and statisticians working together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.

  • We offer competitive pay and perks.
  • We provide meals and a large assortment of snacks and drinks to get you through the day.
  • You’ll get 1:1 mentoring from a talented and motivated employee on your team.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to work on real projects with experienced employees and have a direct impact on the company. (Our internships are not summer camp!)
  • You’ll have the amazing opportunity to participate in one of our Biotechnology Tours where you get out of the office and into the field (literally) with agents and farmers.
  • You’ll work in an award winning office with smart designs, large common areas and open floor plans that fuel collaboration.
  • You’ll attend various company sponsored events, activities and off-sites - we make sure interns are having fun!
  • We regularly host meet-up groups and tech-talks and encourage participation in relevant workshops and conferences
  • You’ll have the opportunity to interaction with key executives and leadership.

We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:

  • Inspire one another
  • Innovate in all we do
  • Leave a mark on the world
  • Find the possible in the impossible
  • Be direct and transparent


Learn more about our team and our mission:

The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference

https://youtu.be/c5TgbpE9UBI or visit https://climate.com/careers


Climate aims to create a welcoming and collaborative environment for our employees in which a diverse set of perspectives and voices are represented and celebrated. 

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, The Climate Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sex (including pregnancy), protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any unlawful criterion existing under applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@climate.com.

position: Intern (immediate hire) or Contract - Project Scientist
description:
Overview

6 Month Intern position or Contract - Project Scientist/Chemist

The candidate for this position will be hired for a 6 month contract, or a Winter/Spring 2021 internship for immediate hire.

The ideal candidate will possess an academic background in physics, chemistry, or related discipline, with good knowledge of lab principles and practices. A background in instrumentation is essential. The candidate will be responsible for preparing test articles, collection of data, analysis of results, and effective record-keeping and communication.

Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Research and Development with analytical instruments
  • Learn and implement techniques for sample collection and introduction
  • Evaluate instrument performance, analyze data, and report test results
  • Test and evaluate breadboard designs to enhance performance
  • Work closely with other internal groups and external resources to enhance development of instrumentation
  • Attention to detail and precise record-keeping
  • Other duties may be assigned

Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS:

This individual must be a motivated individual with the ability to learn and implement techniques

relating to detection of chemical agents and trace explosive residue. This includes, but not limited to sample collection, desorption, transport, ionization, detection, and analysis. This individual shall also be capable of working independently with reliable record-keeping and communication.

Education and/or Experience:

  • Degree or working toward a degree in Physics, Chemistry, or equivalent
  • Two years hands-on experience with instrumentation desirable

Computer Skills:

  • Standard MS office proficiency
  • Capability to quickly learn new Bruker developed SW programs
  • Programming for test and evaluation is a plus

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

N/A

Other Skills and Abilities:

  • Familiarity with Ion Mobility Spectrometry and Mass Spectrometry helpful
  • At least two-years’ experience with instrumentation such as IMS or MS desired
  • General chemical lab expertise

Other Qualifications:

  • US citizenship required. The ability to obtain and retain a US security clearance is a must.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Must be a team player with good people skills

Bruker is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Certain positions at Bruker require compliance withexport control laws and as a result, all interviewed candidates for all positions will be screened pre-interview to determine theireligibility in light of export control restrictions.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • Office and R&D lab environment
  • Some travel required - up to 4 weeks within 6 month period

Kodak is Hiring!

We are looking for aChemical Process Engineer Internfor Summer 2021.


As aChemical Process Engineer Intern,you would be supporting our Wide Roll Film Manufacturing Team in the Applied Materials and Chemicals Division in Rochester, NY.

Our Intern positions are open to students enrolled in an accredited program during the Internship.

There are several job responsibilities that you would have in supporting our process and equipment engineering team.

Activities and Scope of Work Include:
  • Assistance in troubleshooting of manufacturing issues
  • Analyzing process data
  • Recommending equipment and process upgrades
  • Participating in the design and implementation of projects for reliability and quality improvements
  • Working with the engineering team to scope out existing equipment for the purposes of updating process drawings and clarifying equipment specifications
  • The individual will need to have a chemical engineering background to be able to solve fluid flow problems (for fluid delivery and coating), as well as having an aptitude for interpreting and analyzing data for recommendations changes.
  • The individual will need to be able to possess analytical skills, mechanical skills, and teamwork skills to be able to accomplish the continuous improvement projects and activities.
  • The individual would also work with operations, skilled trades, and engineers to document standard work for the equipment (lock-out procedures, predictive and preventative maintenance tasks, verification procedures)
This intern should have sound mathematical and computer skills (particularly MS Office) in addition to the mechanical skills.
This position will be a hands-on working position in a combination of environments, including both internal and external to the production buildings, and occasionally supporting areas working in reduced lighting area.

Woodard & Curran is an integrated engineering, science, and operations company. Privately held and steadily growing, we serve public and private clients nationwide. We consistently rank among the top firms in the U.S., including Engineering News Record's Top 100 Environmental firms and the Top 200 Design firms.

At Woodard & Curran, we handle a wide range of water and environmental issues, solving complex problems with creativity and tenacity. Woodard & Curran was founded on a simple business concept: if we provide an enjoyable place to work with opportunity, integrity, and commitment, we will attract talented people who thrive and excel at their work. Those people are at the heart of our firm, solving some of the most pressing water and environmental challenges for our clients.

Overview:

We are looking for a motivated Engineer, Geologist or Environmental Science intern to join our company. If you want to jump-start your career and expand your skills while working alongside talented experts, then this is the opportunity for you! You will be involved with project work from day one, working side-by-side with experienced engineers and scientists helping our clients address their site development, remediation, and water and environmental challenges. Exercise your creativity and problem-solving skills in a supportive environment. We are a mission-driven organization that puts our people first, with a culture that focuses on providing meaningful work, engaging challenges, recognition, and reward.

Responsibilities:

Duties and responsibilities vary based on level of experience and project expectations. An intern will generally shadow experienced professionals and participate as a member of a team by contributing to actual projects. Interns must be able to apply what they have learned “in the classroom” to our projects and work assignments.

The selected candidate may be expected to complete tasks for site investigation and remediation projects;

support and perform civil design calculations for various projects (including designs related to landfill and natural gas drilling pad developments); report preparation assistance; data management support through the use of spreadsheets and databases; environmental literature searches/reviews and support for field work. Field work may include logging soil borings and test pits; monitoring well, surface water and sediment sampling; contractor and construction oversight; and completion of field documentation of site activities.  The Candidate’s ability to interact and communicate with project staff and co-workers will play an important role in the Candidate’s success.

This position will be based in our Pittsburgh, PA office; however, some travel may be required.

Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will be a third year or recent college graduate with a degree or pursuing a degree in civil or environmental engineering, geology, or in a similar environmental scientific field (environmental emphasis preferred but not necessary).  Additional course work in database management, soil mechanics, hydrology and hydraulics, fluid mechanics, computer programming (ex. Python), AutoCAD and/or GIS is highly recommended. OSHA 40-hour HAZWOPER training is desirable.

Eligible candidates must have a high school diploma and shall submit a professional cover letter and resume. Your resume should include your GPA, previous work experience, planned degree and certifications, relevant course work and projects, and anticipated graduation data.

Woodard & Curran is a Drug Free Workplace.

Woodard & Curran is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Overview

ERT is hiring a Biostatistician Intern who will have the opportunity to learn about Biostatistics while performing tasks in support of clinical trials. This position will provide support through independent and team projects.

 

ERT is a global data and technology company that minimizes uncertainty and risk in clinical trials so that our customers can move ahead with confidence. With more than 45 years of clinical and therapeutic experience, ERT balances knowledge of what works with a vision for what’s next, so it can adapt without compromising standards.

Responsibilities

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Shadow Biostatistical Operations staff and perform designated tasks in support of projects for clinical trials
  • Contribute to internal research projects
  • Assist with development of code to contribute to increased automation and task efficiency.
  • Perform other duties, assignments or special projects as needed

The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description represent the major responsibilities of the position. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned, as required. ERT reserves the right to amend or change this job description to meet the needs of ERT. This job description and any attachments do not constitute or represent a contract.

Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • Pursuit of a Bachelor’s or Graduate degree with major or minor in Statistics, Biostatistics, or Actuarial Science
  • Pproficiency in R programming and/or SAS programming
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work independently in a fast-paced environment.
  • Exceptional computer skills (MS office suite are minimum level required; familiarity with other systems, especially databases, would be very helpful). Ability to learn new systems is required.
  • Exceptional organizational and communication skills.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

DESCRIPTION

Information Network Associates, Inc. (INA) is currently seeking a rising college senior to join our fast-paced Digital Forensics Unit (DFU) as a Part-time Digital Forensics Intern. At INA, we are passionate about protecting people, property, and data. Our DFU Team handles both criminal and civil cases and is driven by the belief that our digital forensics skills are indispensable to the private investigators, companies, attorneys, and local, state, and federal agencies that we serve.


Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain client confidentiality
  • Perform regular lab management and administrative tasks
  • Assist with case load where assigned
  • Manage a special project
  • Availability 8-15 hours/week

Qualifications

  • Enrollment in a digital forensics degree program
  • Full-time college senior student status
  • Knowledge of digital forensics fundamentals
  • Understanding of best evidence practices
  • Familiarity with operating systems

The Digital Forensics Intern will enjoy a collaborative team while gaining real-world laboratory experience. Interested candidates should submit a resume, as well as any education and/or credit requirements, to careers@ina-inc.com

It is the policy of INA to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected characteristics under applicable law. This policy relates to all phases of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, employment, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, reduction of workforce and termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation, selection for training, use of all facilities, and participation in all company-sponsored employee activities. Provisions in applicable laws providing for bona fide occupational qualifications, business necessity or age limitations will be adhered to by the company where appropriate.

INA will take steps to ensure that minority group individuals, females, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, other protected veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans, and qualified disabled persons are introduced into our workforce and considered for promotional opportunities.

About Steppingstone:

Steppingstone Scholars works with families and school partners to provide rigorous educational programming and support for talented underserved students in the Philadelphia region to achieve academic success, opportunity, and a college degree.

In North Philadelphia, Steppingstone works closely with Temple Universityâ€™s College of Education (COE) and three K-8 public neighborhood schools: Dunbar School, Duckrey School, and Bethune School. In West Philadelphia, Steppingstone works with McMichael School.  All together, these partnerships form a College Pipeline Collaborative (CPC). The CPC brings together the academic expertise of COE faculty and student/staff resources with Steppingstoneâ€™s mission focus and expertise in implementing college pipeline programming to bring tangible and impactful resources to students and schools. 

Job Description: The STEAM (Science-Technology-Engineering-Arts-Math) Summer Program Math Teacher will report to the Academic Dean for Math and work in partnership with summer staff to deliver rigorous and engaging summer programming. STEAM Summer Program Math Teachers will leave the program with new skills and ideas to apply to future classrooms or jobs. 

Reports to: Middle Grades Academy Academic Dean 

Employment Type:Hourly, Non-Exempt

Background/ Experience:

  • Passionate about making a difference in the academic outcomes of underserved students
  • Punctual, present, and responsible  
  • Maintains open and consistent communication
  • Demonstrate organizational and technology skills 
  • Ability to work and contribute to a team
  • Ability to seek resources and solutions to effectively solve problems
  • Positive role model
  • Receptiveness to feedback and a desire to continuously improve
  • Dedicated to providing a safe, academically enriching, and engaging summer experience
  • A strong sense of personal accountability for student achievement
  • A belief that all students should be held to high academic standards
  • Experience teaching upper elementary math, middle school math and/or Algebra 1
  • Familiarity with the Pennsylvania academic standards for math
  • Experience and interest in teaching social emotional learning curriculum 
  • Experience working with youth and understanding of trauma informed teaching practices required 
  • Major in Education or STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics) fields preferred but not required

Time Commitment/ Schedule:

  • The STEAM Summer Program is a six-week program that runs from Monday, June 21, 2021  to Thursday, August 5, 2021. There will be no program on Friday,  July 2, 2021. 
  • The STEAM Summer Program usually takes place on Temple Universityâ€™s campus. This year the program will most likely be offered virtually. A decision will be made by May 1, 2021.
  • STEAM Summer Program staff are required to be on site (or on their computer) Monday through Friday from 8 AM to 3 PM. The only exception to this is Tuesday, June 22 when staff will be required to be on site from 11:30 AM - 6:30 PM for Scholars and Family Orientation. 
  • Professional development and preparation will take place from June 21, 22 and 25, 2021 June 22 and 23 are orientation days for students (run by summer staff) and regular program starts on June 28. 
  • Weekly staff meetings and check-ins with deans.  Additional on-going PD as needed. 
  • Additional hours will be available in the Spring for lesson planning and material preparation.
  • Ongoing communication via email and phone with the Steppingstone staff will be necessary.
  • We are seeking candidates interested in working in the program for more than one summer; long-term staff participation strengthens the program and allows for strong relationships with students. 

Responsibilities:

STEAM Summer Program Math Teachers will be required to:

  • Track student attendance daily
  • Support breakfast and/or lunch on a rotating basis (in person only)
  • Execute daily advisory curriculum with students, including individual conferencing 
  • Plan and lead math classes for groups of approximately 12-15 students that incorporate Steppingstoneâ€™s routines and instructional best practices 
  • Opportunity to plan virtual  field trips and/or incorporate guest speakers 
  • Coordinate and support student execution of final capstone project 
  • Utilize classroom management strategies throughout the day
  • Share student work on a weekly basis and maintain inviting and inclusive classroom or online community 
  • Form and maintain relationships with studentsâ€™ families, including phone calls and conferences
  • Participate in ongoing professional development and weekly staff meetings in the spirit of continuous improvement; incorporate feedback given into lessons
  • Contribute writings, pictures, etc to weekly family update
  • Contribute to student progress reports 
  • Promote high expectations of both staff and students
  • Create substitute plans in the event of your absence
  • Other administrative duties as needed

 

Clearance and Training Requirements:

All offers of employment at Steppingstone Scholars are contingent upon clear results of a background check. â€œClear resultsâ€ may differ depending on a personâ€™s record and the nature of their job. Background checks are conducted on all full-time and part-time staff members.

A background check is comprised of the following clearances:

  1. PA Criminal Record Check - $22 cost
  2. PA Child Abuse Check - $13 cost
  3. FBI Fingerprint Check - $23.85 cost
    1. Must come from the Department of Human Services

All clearances must be dated within one year of hire date (the date on an employeeâ€™s offer letter) and received by Steppingstoneâ€™s Office prior to start date. Additionally, all employees are required to complete the â€œRecognizing and Reporting Child Abuse: Mandated and Permissive Reporting in Pennsylvaniaâ€ online training through the University of Pittsburgh 

No person shall start at Steppingstone until all clearance and training requirements are satisfied.
